name: Mecenate Palace

reviews.text: We celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary and four of our eleven days in Italy at the Golden Tulip Mecenate Palace in Rome. It was just Great!
reviews.title: Golden Tulip Mecenate a Winner

reviews.text: The Hotel is charming, with a nice reception area, bar, restaurant and a roof top terrace with a beautiful view.The garden breakfast room is on the rooftop. Our upgraded room was lovely and had a view overlooking Piazza Santa Maria Maggiore.
reviews.title: great hotel
Good Hotel
reviews.text: The Hotel has a very efficient staff, who are always ready to help. The rooms are clean and well maintained.
Lou & Nancy
reviews.title: Excellent, efficient and friendly hotel.

reviews.text: this hotel was in a brilliant location - walking distance to all the top attractions, and was clean and friendly. Breakfast on roof terrace was brilliant and although the rooms werent the most spacious they were adequate for a weekend trip. Would definately stay again.
reviews.title: Take your chances
A Palace Amidst the Rush of Rome
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel in May 2006. The weather was wonderful, which made opening the windows a great choice. The rooms were nice. The breakfast buffet was typical and comparable to every European hotel I have stayed in (coming from Las Vegas, NV we are biased). The views on the rooftop were breathtaking. Best of all, we arrived at 8am in the morning and were automatically given a room....that started the whole trip off just right. The rooms are very quiet, if you keep the windows closed of course because the hotel is wedged between two streets and one round-about. If you are looking for a supermarket, there is one across the street in the basement of the department store. They have a great selection of everything and it is very crowded. On the corner from the hotel, there is this great cafe that is open from 5am to 2am every day and they have out of this world desserts. A few streets over there are some great restaurants. We would recommend this hotel to all if you want something close to everything but just far enough that you have to walk to the train station to catch the Metro or walk just to enjoy the great city of Rome.

Nice hotel from what we saw of our one night - but had to move for the following 3 nights because the hotel had cancelled our booking. We had got a good deal through Opodo, paid a deposit some months earlier and had a confirmed booking but when we arrived, because my credit card had changed in the meantime, they had cancelled the booking without trying to contact us. They had room for the first night only and we had to move to an inferior hotel for the same price the next day. I suspect they could let the room at a higher rate. At check out after the first night they wouldn't allow the deposit I had paid and confirmed directly with them. I refused to sign the credit card slip but they debited it anyway and I had a wrangle with the booking agent and credit card company to get my deposit back.
reviews.title: Hotel cancelled our booking
Our Palace in Rome
reviews.text: The Mecenate is centrally located in a pleasant neighborhood near Roma Termini. The hotel itself is attractive and well-run. The breakfast buffet, both food and ambience, very enjoyable.
We would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Nice room, but major scheduling problems

reviews.text: B& P - New York City
reviews.title: Highly recommend!

reviews.text: We stayed twice at this hotel in March, the first time for 4 nights and then again later in the month for one night. We originally booked the hotel through the Golden Tulip website, but on visiting the hotel's own website they were offering upgrades to deluxe rooms for the standard-room rate for stays of 4 nights or more. We contacted the hotel and in order to receive the upgrade we had to rebook directly with the hotel and cancel the reservation through the Golden Tulip system, but it was well worth doing and the hotel staff e-mailed to confirm the upgrade. For our 4-night stay we had a lovely room on the top floor overlooking the piazza and cathedral. The room was on the small side but beautifully furnished and maintained, with a separate dressing area and a very large marble bath with two sinks. Staff were efficient and helpful. The area was convenient to Termini but far enough away so that it wasn't seedy. The metro station is a couple of blocks down Via Carlo Alberto. There were plenty of restaurants within a few mins walk on or near Via Cavour. We tried a different one every evening and all were of good quality and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.text: On our second stay in the hotel we had a standard room for one night. It was very similar to the deluxe room, without the view and a smaller bath and closet, but still very good value.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel
A fab stay in Rome
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 3 nights in Rome and chose the Mecenate Palace based on your reviews. It was excellent choice for location, comfort and service. The staff were keen to know that we were being taken care of. We upgraded room to a deluxe room overlooking Santa Maria Maggiore and the square - what a fantastic view. Rooms were extremely comfortable and luxuriously decorated with lovely marble bathrooms and robes/slippers (dont know if that is in all rooms). Very efficient double glazing - Rome is a very noisy city. Tea/coffee in the rooms which was most welcome. On arriving a Ciampino we got bus shuttle to Terminii then a 5-10 min easy walk. Terminii area a bit seedy but quite fascinating too. Hotel very close to Metro which we only used to travel to Vatican - we walked to everything else.
My top tips are VERY comfy shoes, a good map and guide book as nothing is signposted - nor is anything labelled in any church/gallery/museum.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: Breakfast terrace lovely inside and out - breakfast more than ample - good choice - croissant/bread/cheese/ham/cereal/fruit/yoghurt.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: We returned home yesterday from a 4 night trip to Rome staying at the 4* Mecanate Palace and we were glad to get back into our own bed as the one here was quite firm. On arrival at the hotel, the receptionist was not very welcoming and was quite surly. We stayed in a superior room on the 5th floor overlooking the road, we did not find this noisy unless we had the window open. The room was nice, though a little chintzy, and small, which appears to be a common theme in city hotels. The breakfast was ok if you like continental, or you can have bacon/eggs etc, but these are quite expensive and probably not worth the money. The bathroom was quite small and the bath/shower leaked, so we had wet carpet near the front door. The hotel didnt provide an iron/board so I felt as if I was walking round very scruffily dressed as I had failed to iron my clothes before I left as I usually do it while I'm at the hotel. However, outside the hotel there were quite a few people alot scruffier than me!. The hotel is very convieniently situated, it is 10 mins away from the main train statiion which takes you to/ from the airport and 5 mins away from a metro station from which you can get to most places in Rome very cheaply. It is also within walking distance to some of the attractions if you like walking. The surrounding area is not the nicest of areas, it is rather scruffy with rubbish scattered and bins not emptied but it is a relatively safe place to walk at night, I didnt feel threatened or intimated at all. I was very disappointed with the restaurants/bars locally, the food was mediocre and often not very hot, we found ourselves travelling round to try to find decent food, but failed. Beware of the cafe on the corner of the hotel - Cafe Santa Maria - they charge 80c for a coffee if you sit inside and 4 euros if you sit outside. My husband had a coffee there one evening, I didnt want one, the coffee arrived with 1 euro coin change which was placed on the table. My husband complained that his coffee was cold so the waiter took away the coffee and the 1 euro coin and came back with a hotter cup of coffee - minus the 1 euro, my husband didnt want to make a fuss so didnt complain. I had an ice cream from there - not the nicest ones around!. If you go to the Vatican Museum - ignore what the guide books say - dont go early. The best time to go is after lunch, about 1.30pm, the queue will usually be about 30 minutes rather than 2 hours if you go in the morning. The best advice I could give a prospective traveller to Rome, chose your hotel location carefully, take very comfortable shoes and dont go if you are on a tight budget. I'm so glad we went, we had a great time, but would stay in a different area if we went back.
reviews.title: Convieniently situated for all attractions
Lovely Place
reviews.text: My husband and I ended our Italian honeymoon with a four night stay at the Mecenate Palace. We made reservations on-line, and we reconfirmed those reservations before leaving as recommended by others on Tripadvisor. When we arrived, the manager was snobbish, but perhaps this is the norm? Despite the frosty reception, we were led to a spacious room on the fifth floor with a fantastic view of Santa Maria Maggiore. The room was nicely decorated and the bathroom was very modern and elegant. We especially enjoyed the bathrobes and the radio system which was accessible in the bathroom and bedroom. The other employees were all very helpful, and breakfast was better than average. Our biggest gripe: the outdoor terrace. While the terrace bar was supposedly open until midnight, each night we went upstairs to find it dark and deserted. Accordingly, on our last night there, we went upstairs armed with a bottle of prosecco, but as fate would have it, the terrace bar was open and they would not allow us to enjoy the prosecco on the terrace. Understandable, but frustrating, nonetheless. All in all, it was a wonderful place to stay at a very affordable price. Finally, I join the previous reviewers warning regarding the cafe on the corner -- my husband and I were not savvy enough to ask for an itemized bill and believe that they overcharged us for a late night dinner.
We stayed at the Mecenate Palace over the May Bank Holiday.
reviews.title: Great Location and Stunning Views!

reviews.text: The location (which I was worried about) was excellent you really can walk every where with no hassles. We stayed for 4 nights so we where upgraged to a deluxe room with a view of the Santa Maria Maggiore (if booked through hotel website) which was wonderful. The room was clean with nice dressing gowns and kettle – very useful – though the fridge wasn't very cold. The room was OK but I expected more from a four star hotel and for the price we paid 770 euros. Breakfast was also only OK standard buffet, but no hot food, although you could purchase eggs etc at extra cost it's saving grace was the lovely roof terrace where it is served. The staff where excellent with good english! We really enjoyed our stay in Rome.
reviews.title: Horrible Service...Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: We have just come back from staying at the Golden Tulip Mecenate Palace. We rented 20 rooms for my wedding. Hopefully this review will give you a broader perspective than most. A brief history: I have treveled extensively around the world (over 40 countries) and understand the differences in services and hotel stays can vary greatly from country to country. This was my 6th trip to Italy and love the country.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and location

description: The Palace is a 4-star luxury hotel, located in the historical centre of Rome, near by Colosseum and Roman Forum, overlooking the breathtaking façade of Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore and the Eternal City's unique skyline.Dimora dell'800 confort del 2000.
